EXTRACTED VALUE: A gratifying slash-'em-up that would have stood out with greater strategy elements. [May 2008, p.76]
Medal of Honor: Airborne, while not perfect, is definitely the best game in the franchise to come along in quite a while.
Bonkers beyond belief, it's not the best in the series, but it's certainly good enough. [Apr 2008, p.74]
The Xbox 360 version stands tall among other collegiate sports games on the console.
Every inch of the hand-drawn kingdom is brimming with endearing eccentricity. [Oct 2008, p.76]
So what if Carbon isn't redefining the street racing genre - really, at this point, what could? It hits a sweet spot of intensity, danger, and style.
Although the game has minor flaws, it is largely an exciting racer that offers huge thrills and spills.
Really enjoyable to play, especially when playing online with a friend, and should be purchased by any destruction loving fan.
Midway finds some fairly uncharted waters in which to lay-anchor, even if the game could be a bit more expansive.
Even with a number of sloppy audio problems and an overall game that feels strikingly similar to Top Spin on the Xbox, it's still hugely addictive.
Brothers in Arms continues the tradition of bringing realistic warfare combat to gaming, honoring the war without sugar coating the truth.
A chilled-out, whacked-out gem of a game and one that demonstrates that games can do ‘funny’ and ‘more accessible’ and pull it off with style.
If you're new to the series, Far Cry Instincts: Predator is an excellent first-person shooter package. [May 2006, p.48]
